body.p:
I am in receipt of your various favors
and also June Occident with my sermon on the “Citizen King.” Your heading it
thus is no misnomer, and is satisfactory. It is very exactly reprinted, and afforded,
let me hope, pleasure to your numerous readers. I am glad you have spoken out plainly
on the subject of a “personal messiah.” The events of the past, and those looming out of the
future do not present anything so favorable to the Jewish mind that it should adopt the
opinions of Maunheimer and Horwitz on the subject. I, for one, am undesirous of abandoning
the rich hopes of Israel's return to Palestine, and the universal belief in monotheism among
the families of the earth, together with the reign of absolute peace throughout the world,
and all the priceless blessings attendant thereon, for the vague ideas and generalities of
Jewish neologists. I am for לתורה ולתעודה content to die hopefully אף על פי לתמהיה

What say you to the “Powenir? party of Curaçao issuing their shameless caliency?
against their brethren! It is very painful to find Jews thus venting their spite, in the
heat of local dissension, to the detriment and perhaps future evil of all Israel. I allude
to their publishing the libel that ולמלשנים is directed against Christians. May the
consequences of disseminating this falsehood not recoil on themselves. The pastoral
letter of Rabbi Chumaceiro you must have seen by this time, as well as the “dingy
sheet” containing the slander. You surely will not suffer your pen to be idle in this
emergency, we all expect to see a scathing answer from you on the whole question.
I had already in the pulpit exposed, in part, its other falsity; and intend going on till the
subject be exhausted. The head and front of the party was here a week ago,
but I declined meeting him or extending him any courtesy. I told his friends that

with to his and party's views on the subject of synagogal and other reforms I would
not have attacked, but when he and they issued a slanderous impretation? against
their own flesh and blood, it was time, since it affected the reputations of every
individual Israelite, that their ignorance and malevolence should be exposed.
His name is Abraham Cohen Henriques. His chief collaborators and his brother
Solomon Cohen Henriques, his brother in law Augel Jessuron?, a Doctor Henriques
and a Doctor Senior. These are the חמשה טובי עיר. A. C. H. writes in Dutch. His
effusions are then translated into French by Dr. H, and Augel Jessuron then
puts the precious ideas into Spanish. But the filtration does not purify the
feculent matter which gutters? from their pens. It is said that A. C. H. came on
here on a speculative trip to obtain subscribers to the party, and contributions to
their new proposed new Synagogue, the worship in which is, sans doute, to eclipse, in its bold
departure from the ancient standards of practice, and that the German and
American Reformers have hitherto established. I do not think he gained
either subscribers or subscriptions and as his attack on the Jews was
generally denounced in no unmeasured terms by even nominal Israelites,
he could not have gone home rejoicing.

My post here is not an easy one, but I am disposed to accept the
difficulties it presents. Fortunately the By Laws which stipulate that
the worship shall be according to that followed by the Spa. & Portug. Jews, and
the power the Laws invest me with of directing and conducting the whole
economy of public worship, is are obstacles to any sudden or ill considered
changes in the ritual or worship. I can take my stand on these protecting
defenses, and refuse to sanction what the majority of Israel disapproves of. Quietness however reigns at present, yet the time may not be so distant for
the outbreak of disturbances. But I do not apprehend such violence as
the Porrenir? party have exhibited.
We have had some little display of irreligion not withstanding. Your old

correspondent M B. Simmonds, now poor no longer, but rich in worldly goods,
has been staggered by Colenso, and openly declares himself a Unitarian!! ? his
disbelief in the Bible! On my election, people were taxed more highly to pay my salary, among
others himself. To get rid of this demand of the Synagogue, he applied to be admitted a
member of the Lutheran church; they authorities consented to take his money, taxed him
$32 ? allotted him a seat in church &c, but the Govermt. told him he must
pay his finta? to the Synagogue also, unless he became a Christian. Of course if Colenso
unsettled his belief as a Jew, he did not predispose him to to take up xleavity?
instead, so at the present moment he contributed to Shool and Church, and belongs
to neither. Another German Shofel likewise refused to pay the whole of his
tax and sent a letter to the representatives that if they did not reduce it to half
he would apostatise. They sent him no answer, but recorded a strong resolution
on their minutes condemnatory of his conduct. He went to the Moravians, and applied
to become a member; but on being told that he must learn certain test books by
heart, and he examined on them in open assembly prior to being baptised, he withdrew in disgust. So
you see I do not repose on a bed of roses

I inclose herewith the receipt of the Captn. of the Responsible
and your Invoice Amtg to $78.50 The books have not come to hand,
they must have been amongst that part of the cargo condemned and
sold at Bermuda. I want the small Bibles and Roads to Faith
badly, and Prayer Books too. I wrote all about them in the
letter I gave my brother, and which I suppose he has handed you.

Well the Great General Grant perhaps may not turn out
a Ulysses after all, and the south may yet conquer a peace. I
fervently hope and pray they may, and tho' I would be loth to see any
part of the Federal territory ravaged and despoiled as the Union soldiery
treated the Confederate territory, yet little commiseration would be felt
if northern soil were made to feel what it is to be trodden by the armed

heel of the invader. Down to date the southerners appear to have
the best of it. The deserve success, for they have sacrificed their
own lives to achieve it, and not hired mercenaries to fight their
battles. My brother has frightful northern proclivities. His opinion
of northern honor and political honesty is lofty and grand. We
are widely different in our Estimate of the result, and the
ability as well as inclination of the Federal states to pay the
public creditor. I hope he will not be one of the sufferers;
I have urged him till I am weary to sell out, and have
nothing to do with Greenbacks and 5/20s, and on the finely
engraved promises to pay of Mr. Chase, but all my entreaties
have been of no avail.

I will write you soon again. I delivered your
message to Mr. Osorio about the £14. The Revd. Dr. Myers of
Kingston Ja has received notice that his services will not be
required after his term of engagement expires, this time next year.
Mrs. Nathan and her mother send their kind regards to you
and all old friends. Mayor Wolff's golden wedding will
take place on 31st August, Grand preparations are being made
for the event. I will write you all about it when it comes
off. Chamacero is coming over for the occasion.
God bless and protect you prays

The heat is dreadful. It is really a great effort to write
a long letter, and I am sure you will appreciate it.
Tell my brother, if with you, that I will write soon
בברכה
